definition: Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: He listed himself as a conservative.
sentences.chinese: 他自称是一个保守主义者。

sentences.english: Part one is directed at the domestic and international situations that bred neoconservatism.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分探讨了新保守主义兴起的国内和国际背景。

sentences.english: Now who's the fear mongering American neocon Republican?
sentences.chinese: 现在是谁使美国的新保守主义共和党恐惧呢？

sentences.english: This marks the end of the conservative ascendancy of the past 30 years.
sentences.chinese: 这标志着保守主义长达30年的主导地位的终结。

sentences.english: Third, Mr Sarkozy is ready to confront France's bastions of conservatism.
sentences.chinese: 第三，萨科齐先生准备好面对法国保守主义的堡垒。

sentences.english: Conservatives can't learn new things and forget about old things.
sentences.chinese: 保守主义者学不会新东西，也忘不掉旧东西。

sentences.english: Their adamantine conservatism is the slow outgrowth of this experience.
sentences.chinese: 这种经历缓慢地培育了他们顽固的保守主义。

sentences.english: The neoconservative policy response to an undead uprising would be simple and direct.
sentences.chinese: 新保守主义对亡灵造反的政策回应是简单而直接的。

sentences.english: Compassionate Conservatism is the political guiding ideology of Bush Government.
sentences.chinese: 富有同情心保守主义是布什政府的政治指导思想。

sentences.english: The more outspoken ponder openly whether the party leader is really a Conservative at all.
sentences.chinese: 更直率公开地思考党领导是否是真正的保守主义者。

sentences.english: First, he tried in a typically conservative fashion to tighten the money supply.
sentences.chinese: 首先，他以一种典型的保守主义姿态试图收缩银根。

sentences.english: In a prolonged recession, gale-force winds of protectionism will blow.
sentences.chinese: 经济衰退持续越长，保守主义的势头将越猛烈。

sentences.english: One neocon sums up the prevailing mood in the movement.
sentences.chinese: 一位新保守主义者概括了运动中的主流倾向。

sentences.english: Neo- conservatism prevailed in the Reagan era.
sentences.chinese: 在雷根当政期间，新保守主义盛行。

sentences.english: He is challenging the idea of minimalism by introducing elegance and softness.
sentences.chinese: 他引入了优雅和柔和，不断挑战着保守主义。

sentences.english: But conservatives and rightwingers are not the only racists.
sentences.chinese: 但是保守主义者和右翼分子并非唯一的种族主义者。

pinyin: duo1 yuan2 wen2 hua4 zhu3 yi4
she4 hui4 min2 zhu3 zhu3 yi4
zi4 you2 yi4 zhi4 zhu3 yi4

definition: nationalism/national self-determination/principle of nationalism, the first of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning parity between China and the great powers)/racism
